name: Scott Moss
text:
My mother-in-law got her hearing aids here. She spent $5000  and she could not hear a rocket strapped to a train going through her living room.

Not cool at all.

resp.text: Mr. Moss I am sorry if your mother in law is have issues with her hearing aids. I am not aware of any issues anyone is having. Please feel free to call me or have your mother in law call me cell 256-490-4327 Todd Wright. Look forward to correcting her problems.

name: Joy Steadham
text: Made an appointment at the Grandview office of ENT Associates and after 2 hours in this office, I left without any treatment or conclusion in regards to my visit. Two weeks later, I visited a local Doc in the box (Med Center Hoover), in which they let me know within 30 minutes of being in the office I had fluid behind my ear which was causing the issues I had gone to a PROFESSIONAL for. Upon leaving ENT associates I was under the impression that of 24 years of age I was suffering from tinnitus, as well as needed to consider a nose job for my allergy problems. Now after one day of being treated by the local doc in the box, I feel 100 times better. Who knew it was rocket science to take .000005 seconds to look into someone's ear and see fluid, and then connect the dots. 0/10 for ENT Associated at Grandview, don't waste your time.

text: The doctors and staff of ENT Associates of Alabama are wonderful!  Dr. O'Neil at St. Vincent's is AMAZING!! But when you leave, you don't feel like you were just a number and rushed out of there.  I highly recommend ENT Associates!!

name: Jill Carter
text:
We go to the St. Vincent's office in Trussville.

Dr. Christopher Clark is amazing with both Adults and Children.. My 5 year old ADORES him and trusts him completely. They REALLY CARE about their patients and have ALWAYS found time to see us THAT DAY if it is urgent... Even if it means staying later after hours.

My daughter needed her tonsils out, he did his first available and did a Great Job!!

And the staff, they are the kindest and hardest group of workers I have ever met. There is child area in the waiting room full of books and lots of other fun stuff W(is actually cleaned often)!

I would recommend them (especially Dr. Clark) to EVERYONE!

text: My wife had surgery at St. Vincent’s on Monday and Dr. Black and his team were awesome. St. Vincent’s Hospital was a wonderful  experience. From the time we checked in at 4:45 am until we left, even the special kindness shown to us by the young lady who went to retrieve our car did not go unnoticed. We were very impressed. Thank you!

text: The allergy department staff is awesome!! They are interested in me and make sure that I’m doing well with the medicine!! Deana and Libby take excellent care of me and are very encouraging and attentive!! I wouldn’t go anywhere else and I highly recommend this department to everyone!!

text: Amazing group of doctors! All are wonderful! They’ve been treating my sinus and allergy problems for four years now. I would recommend this group to anyone with ear, nose, and throat issues.

text: Arrived 15 minutes early for appointment. Waited 2.5 hours, and still had not seen the doctor. Left to return to work. I understand the overbooking process, but patients would appreciate a heads up for long waits, or even alternative dates to ensure a quick visit. This is unfortunate, because I've otherwise had a pleasant experience at previous visits.

text: The Allergy team is phenomenal!  Libby and Deana have great attitudes, and their customer service is fantastic.  I always enjoy my "one-time-per-vial" visits.  Thanks, ladies!

text: Wonderful business!! text: Great Customer Service, very clean, knowledgeable, and Nina (I hope I spelled correctly) is super friendly, very welcoming, and efficient. text:
Been seeing Dr. McFadden here for three or four years now. He started me on allergy shots and makes sure I have the right meds (nasal sprays) to keep from getting sinus infections. He's great, his staff are great, and the allergy clinic is great.

Also, #rocketcityrocks 😁

name: Cameron Blake
text:
I personally would not recommend going here, unless you were referred for a particular condition.

I went in, without a referral, as I have been having really disorienting issues with higher pitched sounds. I was given a told I'd be getting an Ear Drum Pressure Test, as well as a test to check my hearing.

I reluctantly agreed, believing that these tests were going to be beneficial to helping my problem. I agree that the pressure test was a good idea, but after taking the hearing test, I realize I was big scammed. I not once said I had any issues with low range noises, and this hearing test did not AT ALL consist of anything that might prove beneficial for my case. It was entirely low range based, nothing to do with why I went in. I never once said I had any issues hearing anything, beyond high frequencies causing my discomfort.

After the tests, I went back to meet with the Dr. again just to be told "Sorry, we do not have anything to test high frequencies."  Well, I would have appreciated knowing that before I agreed to these tests. The final ruling was that I may be experiencing age related hearing loss, but I am only 23 y/o.

I received a bill for $55 for a hearing test which I did not need, which also provided zero benefit for me. At least the $23 ear pressure test made sense.
Overall, $120 wasted for absolutely nothing.

name: Abby Burke
text: Do not recommend. I was referred here by my general practitioner for dizziness, fluid in my ears, ear pain, ear pressure, itching, etc. I saw a nurse practitioner which was my choosing. The wait to see the actual doctor was a lot longer. It was like they were herding cattle in this place. Very busy with little to no niceties. The NP briefly asked my symptoms, did a check with some machine to see if I had fluid on my ears and that was it. She referred me out to their physical therapy office in Madison for EAR issues and dizziness. No thanks. Never looked at my sinuses or likewise. I still have the exact same symptoms that I've had for months and this office did nothing to help nor did they take the time to actually listen and evaluate me. I will find another ENT in this area.

name: J Chambers
text: I really like Dr Alapati.  Some may think he seems a little aloof, but I think he is serious minded and thoughtful. He thinks about your issues. He is otherwise friendly and very knowledgeable.

name: David Schleimer
text: Dr. Alapati is a highly skilled and dedicated professional! I would recommend Dr. Alapati to anyone seeking care for head and neck malignancies or general ENT concerns.

name: Ashley Ward
text: Dr.K is wonderful! Our 2 year old had to have surgery, and he took the time to fully explain everything going on. Very patient and kind. Appointments always ran on time.

name: Re Run
text: Terrible experience. It was stressed before the appointment to arrive early to complete documentation for the visit. For my 9:40 appointment I arrived around 8:50 and completed all the paperwork in 10 to 15 minutes where I was told I would soon be called back. I'm guessing that meant at some point that day. I set for hour and a half waiting to be seen as people who arrived after me were called back, and were leaving as I still waited. After finally being called back, I recieved a dry greeting from the nurse who walked me back to the room where the remaining staff just glared, clearly looking but choosing not to greet. My nurse then walks me into the wrong exam room where another patient was already sitting. We will just call that a clerical error. I finally make it to the exam room where the doctor shortly follows and begins the examination where he begins to ask my symptoms. Not that he actually cared, seeing that he didnt let me finish a sentence. I never finished giving him the details before he told me that I had nothing to worry about and gave me the same recommendation I'd received previously with no examination. The two month wait for an appointment was summed up in a five minute appointment and a two hour wait. What was my first visit will certainly be my last. I'd rather make the drive to any other location than to ever receive service from here again.

name: Patrick Obarr
text: I have mixed feelings on this place. I have been seeing my ENT doctor their for 17 years. Not releasing his name. But if you looking for a doctor and place for surgery this would probably be the place but if you looking for a regular ENT doc for recurring issues it’s not. Example I have frequent ear infections call to get an appointment. They say we can see you in 2 months that’s no help. Not to mention the hours waiting to be seen. I honestly think the doctors here are great just they have taken on waaay too many patients to be able to be efficient!!!!!

text: My experience with North Alabama ENT has been excellent, especially with Dr. Scott McCary.

text: Dr. Scott Mccary  has done two sinus surgeries  on me. He did one three years ago and one today.  He is a very caring doctor and he cares about you being in pain.  I would recommend  him to anyone that need a good ENT.

name: Jerry Smith
text: The Dr. was very thorough and made me feel that I was in good care. However, I waited over an hour past my scheduled time. My second visit I was running a little late and called them twenty minutes before my scheduled appointment and was told that if I didn't make it within ten minutes after that I would have to reschedule. So instead of driving thirty minutes and chancing "one minute late" being too late I decided to reschedule. I was told it would be twenty five dollars for the late reschedule. So instead I just cancelled the appointment all together. I would rather go to a place that doesn't expect you to wait as long as they want you to without trying to work with you much at all. I'm sure the doctors are all great but I'll take my business elsewhere. The crew lost the company my money.

Melody Fergerson

I don’t mind the wait but the attitude was too much. I’d wouldn’t pay anyone for that type of service

text: I wish there was another doctors office that specialized in ear nose and throat. I will definitely search for an alternative. After today I am almost willing to drive to Birmingham if need be. Waited over a month for an appointment only for it to be scheduled at the wrong office and even though we had more than enough time to make it to the Huntsville office, and were willing to drive, They still would not see my child who has moderately severe breathing issues or even give an excuse for work/school. i count this as bad customer service. Does anyone know of an alternative for this practice?

name: Patrick Smith
text:
Very impressed by the staff and doctors at North Alabama ENT; Despite their having possibly hundreds of patients each week, I made to feel that I was more than just another appointment.   Doctors Kostrzewa and Teachey were both accessible and took time to personalize my experience.  Scheduling was prompt and they kept me personally included in the process; More than once I received personal calls directly from the actual doctor with prompt updates.   I believe their thorough and logical approach very well may have saved my life.

I would highly recommend their services. Whatever you do... never ignore a persistent lump on your neck!

name: Jacob Parker
text: I have been visiting Dr. McFadden over the last several years. The staff has always been very helpful and kind. Dr. Mcfadden also performed my deviated septum surgery with no complications whatsoever. I can’t recommend this place enough.

name: Flora Adams
text: Dr. Hobbs did my tonsillectomy and I can't recommend him and his staff highly enough. They were able to schedule me very quickly for the surgery (I had to get it done over spring break my final semester of college before getting married and moving out of the country... They scheduled me just 1.5 weeks out from the surgery due to the situation), were polite and friendly and prompt throughout the entire process, answered all my questions fully and respectfully, and gave me a clear and accurate understanding of what the recovery would be like as an adult getting a tonsillectomy. Dr. Hobb's nurse and the Surgery Center both called and checked up on me multiple times after the surgery, and the surgery itself went exactly as planned. I was able to see Dr. Hobbs in less than 24 hours when I called with concerns about healing on one side of my thoat 3 weeks after the surgery. Beyond this, I mentioned during the initial consultation that my fiancé was having surgery overseas, and Dr. Hobbs asked how the surgery went for him both at my surgery and at the check in 3 weeks after. His concern (and the fact that he remembered) was very encouraging.

name: Allison Cash
text: I see Dr. Martin for thyroid issues and my son sees Dr. Kostrzewa for significant nasal/septum issues.  I have been pleased with the conservative treatment from both doctors, and I greatly appreciate that they explain everything thoroughly.  After being prescribed a nose spray that my insurance doesn't adequately cover, we came up with an alternative treatment that works just as well.   I also have been pleased with the office staff.  I was running late for an appointment because of being stuck at a light due to a traffic accident.  I called the office to let the know, and they were very understanding.  They are a very busy office, so I imagine they are fairly strict with their policies.  I haven't run into any problems though.  All in all, I would highly recommend this practice.

name: Katy Murphy
text: My daughter and I both see Dr. Kostrzewa and we are very pleased! He put tubes in my daughter's ears when she was 10 months and the procedure went well - she's now 3 years old and we've had zero issues since then. Also, he did sinus surgery on me due to chronic sinus infections. He did a great job of explaining everything about the procedure and recovery - I felt very comfortable with him and everyone else involved doing the surgery. I hate that other people have had bad experiences, but I have nothing but good things to say about this place!

text:
If I could give negative stars I would!  This is the most horrific ENT location EVER. How this place is still in practice is beyond the understanding of  God. I got a refferal for chronic hoarseness they never called me to confirmed my appointment. I recieved a bill for a no show appointment. I didn't even know they were my doctors. Frack, I didn't even know where this location was or  even stepped foot in there to sign paperwork. When I called to have it removed they refused saying this is just their  policy and I would only get a refund if the doctor said so. They confirmed an automated system called me but the call only lasted 2 SECONDS for "whatever reason". Did not a live person care to call?? Upon my question she said they don't place calls to patients for appointments. What in the world 🌍? Then they said they'll call me back.... guess what they didn't  call back, just like they didn't call me to inform me of a appointment. How surprising...😑

If you can drive even an hour to another doctor... DO IT!!!!!

Notice the ONLY 5 star rating was from a review from YEARS AGO with no comment. Most likely is fake.

name: Christi Dutton
text:
I went to see Dr. Brocato a year ago. I was having vertigo attacks, ringing in my right ear along with pressure, and I explained I was having problems listening to people on the phone with my right ear. I took a hearing test at their office before the doctor saw me. Dr. Brocato walked in sat down and told me there was nothing wrong with my hearing and it must be allergies. He prescribed me the most expensive nasal spray on the market and sent me on my way. I suffered for a while and just tried to take different allergy medicines. I then started having more frequent vertigo attacks. A year later I decided something must be going on and asked to be referred to a different ENT.

I have now been diagnosed with Meniere's Disease. In the beginning of the disease there is a period of fluctuating hearing loss. If caught in time there is a chance to save the patients hearing. Thanks to Dr. Brocato overlooking my complaints and not scheduling a follow up visit for me, I now have permanent hearing loss in my right ear at the age of 29.

It was the worst medical experience I have ever had. He was very casual and treated me like a hypochondriac. We rely on doctors with "specialties" to be able to help us when things go wrong. Dr. Brocato completely overlooked my symptoms and brushed me off and now I am left dealing with the aftermath. It may not have been malpractice but it is bad practice.

resp.text: Thank you for your feedback.  We understand the frustration of long wait times. However, we assure you that we take your comments seriously and use them as an opportunity for improvement and training.  Thank you for entrusting us with your ENT treatment.

name: Cameron Workman
text: I can't speak on the specialists due to the fact I felt that no one in this place deserved my copay and business, but let me say the front desk has some major issues. Rude and lazy are understatements. The waiting room is something out of a comedy skit. We walked in to folks standing around legitimately elevator level crowded and as I laughed it off a woman said to me that she's seen 6-7 people on the floor multiple times. There's not enough floor space for 5 and nah I'm not going to sit on a dusty carpet floor inch to inch with folks hacking just to see a Dr. for sinus issues. Counterintuitive. Common sense would tell you that anyone good at their practice or caring and about their oath would not subject patients to a space that will literally worsen the conditions they're there with and willing to pay someone to help fix. If this is a purely for profit practice with no sense of compassion I understand business is business; my advice is to work on office space and hire some hard working smiling individuals. Customer service is the beginning and end to all business and if you can't understand that you will never multiply in profit or resources. Simple. Plenty of offices about 30 minutes South, East, and North of here that aren't a scene from an 80s episode of SNL. Have a blessed one!

text: I have suffered from sinus issues and infections for over 25 years. I have seen other specialists. Dr. Robertson is by far the best ENT I have ever been treated by. Dr. Robertson and his people are so kind and thorough. After a hearing test, an allergy test and catscan he discovered my sinuses were blocked with little to no openings in the passages. The surgery was scheduled quickly and the care was fantastic. The recovery was not bad at all. I have never felt better in my life. I can finally breathe through my nose with no obstruction, and I am not getting a sinus infection every month anymore. My family can even tell a difference in my mood. The surgery has been life changing. If you need ENT care, Dr. Robertson and his people are incredible.  Highly recommend.

name: Independent thinker
text:
Went in, thought I had bad allergy, was told by Dr Robertson I was allergic to  everything but mold and mildew. I had a bad feeling about it then. He suggested surgery to get air moving, idiot like I agreed. I could tell no difference after healing, didn't approach my original problem. I feel he wanted to pad his pocket at my expense.
I went to another Doctor, he didn't do the age old skin prick test, he drew blood and sent it off to be tested. Came back I was allergic to dogs only and just enough to register on the test it was so slight. Said I will probably have to have surgery to get it straight. Dr Robertson didn't do the job right.  He only did part of the job needed, why would he not do the whole job and not put someone through all that again?
GO AT YOUR OWN RISK!

name: Breunca Meadows
text: My experience started off good and went horribly wrong from there. Working in the health field I've learned that a patients health history pays a vital key in treatment. I show up to my 5:45 appointment for my surgery apparently no one from the nurses to the doctor reviewed my medical history which stated that I was anemic . After being prepped for my surgery I was then told that I wouldn't be having the surgery due to me being anemic. Which was stated that same day more than once to two different people. On top of wasting my time, including the week that I had already taken time off from work which was now a waste, I was told that I could  call back in two - three months once I was "cleared" to have the surgery! I wouldn't recommended to anyone who has any type of predisposed health issue.

resp.text: We are so sorry for the inconvenience.  We always put our patient's safety first.  Unfortunately, safety concerns can arise at any time.  Please give us a call if you have any additional questions.  Thank you!

name: Kevin Foote
text: Dr. Robertson changed my life! I visited him after hearing a radio commercial about balloon sinuplasty, and I was skeptical at first but after years and years of chronic sinus problems, I was desperate to try anything. Dr. Robertson was very warm & personable, and I could tell he really cares. Most doctors I've met are sort of callous, and it's hard to find one that'll talk to you like a real person. Kudos to Dr. Robertson for making me feel comfortable about this, because it's a lot to consider & a lot of money. I elected to go with the procedure, and I'm so glad that I did. I can breathe so much better now, I'm sleeping better, and I'm no longer constantly bothered by my sinuses throughout the day. I'm not breathing perfectly, of course, but I can definitely feel a significant improvement. I think as long as you're nor expecting rainbows & unicorns but can keep your expectations reasonable, you'll be satisfied. If I could go back in time, I would have the procedure again. Thank you Dr. Robertson!

name: JP
text: Dr. Robertson is a great doctor.  The best ENT in Birmingham. Dr. Robertson performed sinus surgery on me back in 1998. I was having severe miagrane headaches that would last for days.  After surgery I felt 100% better. I was amazed at the result. Also Dr. Robertson does NOT pack your sinuses after surgery. Today I'm still doing great and haven't had any other problems with my sinuses.

text:
I have had chronic sinus infections  for years.  My ears felt stopped up which was affecting my hearing.  Dr Robertson found the problem.  He suggested balloon  sinuplasty.  This has enabled my sinuses to drain properly and has alleviated  constant sinusitis. This procedure also opened my  ears.
The balloon sinuplasty  helped me so much, I took my mother (90) to see Dr Robertson.  She has had constant sinus problems for years.  Dr Robertson suggested the same procedure.  She is having great results, also.

name: Sweet Home Alamanda
text:
Dr. Robertson is absolutely amazing. I originally went in to see him about sinus issues that were making me miserable. He suggested that I undergo allergy testing. I did and my results revealed that I was allergic to 90% of what I was tested for, and I was severely allergic to most of those. I have started Rush Immunology and I look forward to feeling better in the future! Due to my anatomy (as found on CT Scan) Dr. Robertson recommended surgical intervention, and he performed a Septoplasty on me as well as addressed several other sinus-related issues during the procedure. Yes, post-op pn is never fun, but I am hoping to reap the benefits of the surgery in the near future.
I cannot thank Dr. Robertson enough as he has been so knowledgeable and helpful in explaining exactly what he feels is going on with my allergy and sinus issues. When I first met him, he came in and sat down and took plenty of time speaking with me...even after being in a long day of surgery. He is never rushed in my appts, and spends a good amount of time explaining things. His staff has also been so friendly, helpful and knowledgeable as well. I appreciate Dr. Robertson and his awesome staff more than they will ever know! Thank you ALL so very much!!!
(*FYI regarding another review below, the blood test used for allergy testing is NOT AT ALL considered to be the most effective at finding accurate results; research this)
